meanings.definition: Continue to have (something); keep possession of.
meanings.sent1: She retained her favorite toy for many years.
meanings.sent2: He retained his childhood memories despite growing older.
meanings.sent3: The magician retained the audience's attention with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The old house retained a sense of mystery in its hidden rooms.
meanings.sent5: The recipe retained its delicious flavor even after many years.

meanings.sent1: The company retained its loyal employees by offering good benefits.
meanings.sent2: She retained her best employee by recognizing his hard work.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant retained its chef by giving him a raise.
meanings.sent4: The coach retained his star player by offering a new contract.
meanings.sent5: The school retained its experienced teachers by providing support and training.

meanings.sent1: The jar retained the delicious aroma of the spices.
meanings.sent2: The box retained all the treasures safely inside.
meanings.sent3: The balloon retained the air despite being squeezed.
meanings.sent4: The sponge retained the water until squeezed out.
meanings.sent5: The bag retained the freshness of the bread for a long time.
